alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 27 at 9:42PM PST until January 29 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. .Long duration rainfall has caused area rivers to rise, and the Coquille River at Coquille will be close to reaching minor flood stage. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM PST Saturday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Showers will continue overnight, causing the Coquille River to continue rising. - Forecast...The current forecast indicates a crest of 20.9 feet, which is below flood stage. However, should the showers be on the heavier side, the river could reach flood stage. Therefore, a River Flood Watch is advised. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM PST.
